solution.text:
Let the number of the plots be x.
Therefore,
Length of each plot = x m
And, width of each plot = (2x - _{j}_)m
So, the area of rectangular = \(length\times width\)
i.e., \(Area = x\times (2x - _{j}_)\)
Therefore,
i.e., \(_{{pow(j,2)}}_ = x\times (2x - _{j}_)\)
i.e., \(2x^2 - _{j}_x = _{{pow(j,2)}}_\)
i.e., \(2x^2 - _{j}_x - _{{pow(j,2)}}_ = 0\)
Therefore, the number of plots satisfies the quadratic equation :
\(2x^2 - _{j}_x - _{{pow(j,2)}}_ = 0\)
Now solving this quadratic equation to find the number of plots, using factorisation.
i.e.,\(2x^2 - _{j}_x - _{{pow(j,2)}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \(2x^2 - _{{2*j}}_x + _{j}_x - _{{pow(j,2)}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \(2x(x-_{j}_) - _{j}_(x-_{j}_)\) = 0
i.e., \((x-_{j}_)\times (2x-_{j}_)\) = 0
i.e., \((x-_{j}_)=0\) and \((2x-_{j}_)=0\)
i.e., x = _{j}_ and x = \(_{j}_\over 2\)
Since, Length and width should be more than zero
Thus,
length = _{j}_m and width = _{j}_m
Therefore, length+width = _{{2*j}}_

content.text: Ramu has a big land, he wants to divide it in a certain number of rectangular plots, such that the length of each plot(in metres) is equal to the number of plots and width is _{j}_ less than twice the number of plots, and the area of each plot is _{{pow(j,2)}}_\(m^2\). Find the sum of length and width.
